docs.snippet: Justice Department officials met Wednesday with police commanders, mayors and FBI leaders from across the country to discuss ways to reduce violent crime....
docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Department officials met Wednesday with police commanders, mayors and FBI leaders from across the country to discuss ways to reduce violent crime.

headline.main: Justice Dept, Police Gather for Summit on Violent Crime

docs.snippet: The U.S. airstrike on a hospital in Afghanistan, which U.S. officials have called a "mistake," may have exceeded the rules American forces have operated under since their combat mission ended nearly a year ago, officials say....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. airstrike on a hospital in Afghanistan, which U.S. officials have called a "mistake," may have exceeded the rules American forces have operated under since their combat mission ended nearly a year ago, officials say.

headline.main: Did US Strike on Afghan Clinic Exceed Combat Authority?
headline.print_headline: Did US Strike on Afghan Clinic Exceed Combat Authority?

docs.snippet: Investigators of the deadly U.S. air attack on a hospital in Afghanistan are focusing not only on how it unfolded but also on whether the decision to open fire broke the military's own rules for when to use force, officials say. Multiple U.S. brea...
docs.lead_paragraph: Investigators of the deadly U.S. air attack on a hospital in Afghanistan are focusing not only on how it unfolded but also on whether the decision to open fire broke the military's own rules for when to use force, officials say. Multiple U.S. breakdowns may have led to the aerial pummeling.

headline.main: Multiple US Breakdowns May Have Led to Mistaken Attack
headline.print_headline: Multiple US Breakdowns May Have Led to Mistaken Attack

docs.snippet: A U.S. government review board has decided that an Afghan prisoner at Guantanamo who once faced trial by military commission can now be released from custody at the U.S. base in Cuba, the Pentagon said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. government review board has decided that an Afghan prisoner at Guantanamo who once faced trial by military commission can now be released from custody at the U.S. base in Cuba, the Pentagon said Wednesday.

headline.main: US: Afghan at Guantanamo Who Faced Trial Can Now Be Released
headline.print_headline: US: Afghan at Guantanamo Who Faced Trial Can Now Be Released

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama apologized to Doctors Without Borders on Wednesday for the American air attack that killed at least 22 people at its hospital in Afghanistan, and said the U.S. would examine military procedures to look for better ways to pre...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama apologized to Doctors Without Borders on Wednesday for the American air attack that killed at least 22 people at its hospital in Afghanistan, and said the U.S. would examine military procedures to look for better ways to prevent such incidents.

headline.main: Obama Apologizes to Aid Group for US Attack on Afghan Clinic
headline.print_headline: Obama Apologizes to Aid Group for US Attack on Afghan Clinic

docs.snippet: The relationship between U.S. police and the communities they serve is like a struggling marriage in need of better communication, the mayor of Baltimore, a city rocked by anti-police rioting, said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The relationship between U.S. police and the communities they serve is like a struggling marriage in need of better communication, the mayor of Baltimore, a city rocked by anti-police rioting, said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Baltimore Mayor Likens Police-Community Relations to Struggling Marriage
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Mayor Likens Police-Community Relations to Struggling Marriage

docs.snippet: For tests given last spring under the new Common Core requirements, the description of the results comes down to the different labels each state uses to describe the exact same scores on the same tests....
docs.lead_paragraph: For tests given last spring under the new Common Core requirements, the description of the results comes down to the different labels each state uses to describe the exact same scores on the same tests.
docs.abstract: States' differing criteria for student proficiency in grading standardized test scores has added to inconsistency of academic standards Common Core requirements were intended to redress;  objections to Common Core standards from educators and parents may underlie adjustments of goal posts and broadening of definition of success taking place in some states.

headline.main: Test Scores Under Common Core Show That ‘Proficient’ Varies by State
headline.print_headline: Test Scores Under Common Core Show ‘Proficient’ Varies by State

docs.snippet: The son of late strongman Ferdinand Marcos said Wednesday that Filipinos are no longer concerned about human rights abuses committed under his father's rule, angering activists who said he wants people to forget his father's dictatorship, which a ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The son of late strongman Ferdinand Marcos said Wednesday that Filipinos are no longer concerned about human rights abuses committed under his father's rule, angering activists who said he wants people to forget his father's dictatorship, which a popular revolt ended 29 years ago.

headline.main: Dictator's Son Says Filipinos Care Less About Marcos Abuses
headline.print_headline: Dictator's Son Says Filipinos Care Less About Marcos Abuses

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama on Wednesday apologized to Medecins Sans Frontieres for the deadly bombing of its hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, while the medical charity pressed its demand for an international commission to investigate what it call...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama on Wednesday apologized to Medecins Sans Frontieres for the deadly bombing of its hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, while the medical charity pressed its demand for an international commission to investigate what it calls a war crime.

headline.main: Obama Apologizes for Kunduz Attack, MSF Demands Independent Probe
headline.print_headline: Obama Apologizes for Kunduz Attack, MSF Demands Independent Probe

docs.snippet: The United Nations' top human rights official is calling on the Mexican government to set a timetable for withdrawing military personnel from law enforcement duties and replacing them with well-trained police....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations' top human rights official is calling on the Mexican government to set a timetable for withdrawing military personnel from law enforcement duties and replacing them with well-trained police.

headline.main: UN Rights Official : Mexico Must Withdraw Army From Streets
headline.print_headline: UN Rights Official : Mexico Must Withdraw Army From Streets
